content: lily s popcorn beanie designed by tanya at supaknit knit in the round bottom up and with a seamed double brim for comfort this beanie has a playful popcorn that adds personality the crown is tapered off neatly using double pointed needles for a flattering shape and snug fit materials 12ply bendigo woollen mills wollemi corriedale or classic yarn 78 grams/102metres 6mm 16 circular needle stitch marker 6mm double pointed needles for decreasing darning needle techniques knit purl knit working yarn with cast on edge to form a double brim popcorn - on the one stitch knit into the front and back 5 times then cast off 4 of the stitches from the right hand needle as per youtube video link below https //youtu be/mqj_kpdcfbe si=u_vdegpeyj3ovvq6 alexis winslow - popcorn tutorial or use your preferred method for popcorn or bobble stitch instructions double brim cast on 64 stitches using 6mm circular needles an easy or stretchy cast on is preferred place marker at the start of the round & join round row 1 to 15 knit each stitch for 15 row or until your piece measures 3 this section of stockinette forms the inner brim of the beanie row 16 *knit 1 purl 1 *repeat until marker repeat row 16 for 15 row or your total piece is 6 long see image right join brim edges to create a double brim fold the first 3 of stockinette inside the ribbing section as per middle image on the right pick up your first cast on stitch from the beginning of your work making sure it lines up with your working stitch & place it on your left working needle as per photo below right red arrow indicates ktog your working stitch & the cast on stitch continue all the way around the brim carefully one at a time placing your next cast on stitch onto the working needle and ktog the two stitches together it should look like the image below you can see the smooth stockinette stitch for the inside of your beanie 64 stitches still remain body row 1 knit row row 2 knit row row 3 *popcorn k7 repeat from * row 4 knit row row 5 knit row row 6 knit row row 7 *k4 popcorn k3 repeat from * row 8 knit row row 9 knit row row 10 knit row repeat row 3 through to 10 twice more you should have 3 full sets of the popcorn pattern and your piece measuring 19cm knit row 3 again if you prefer a slouchy style or its for someone with a large head you can repeat row 4 to 7 once more decrease row 1 *k4 ktog *repeat until 4 stitches left k4 54 stitches remain row 2 knit row row 3 *k3 ktog *repeat until 4 stitches left k4 44 stitches remain row 4 knit row row 5 *k2 ktog *repeat 33 stitches remain row 6 knit row row 7 *k1 ktog * repeat 22 stitches
